ground_truth: As the Whomping Willow begins to thrash, its violence oddly muted at this distance, Lupin takes a stick and pokes a knot on the trunk, instantly calming the Willow. We look upward, seeing the tops of the trees etched against the darkening sky. Bats fly toward us, and we follow one as Buckbeak snags it, a tail twitching briefly between his beak before it disappears with a slurp. Harry and Hermione sit together in the lengthening shadows, and Hermione looks at Harry, nodding and not wanting to press him further, then glances beyond the trees toward the Whomping Willow. Shadows emerge under a full moon, revealing Black, Harry, Pettigrew, Lupin, Hermione, Ron, and Sleepwalking Snape. Harry studies himself and Sirius. Hermione glances toward the Willow, and Harry looks back to the tall grass as the werewolf is frozen. As a chill wind rises and the leaves of the trees tremble, eerie shadows flutter over the moon, greasy as smoke, revealing Dementors. Hermione eyes Harry warily as he is transfixed, staring hungrily toward the outcrop. The lake begins to freeze, and one after another, Dementors drop from the sky, vanishing in the cyclone. Desperately, Hermione's eyes flash to the cyclone and the pitiful sight of Harry and Black at the water's edge, dying. Harry's face changes, and he draws his wand, slashing through the trees down to the rocky outcrop, the exact spot where his father appeared. Poising his wand, he looks out over the sea of Dementors on the other side of the lake. A wisp of silver escapes his wand, hovering like a mist, then blooms magnificently, and the trees explode with light. The lake blazes with reflected fire, and Harry stands utterly still, wand extended to the heavens. Across the lake, the Dementors retreat, and Harry waits, still as a statue, until each one is gone before simply letting his arm drop. Whoosh! Harry and Hermione plunge into frame astride Buckbeak, soaring toward the castle. Hermione contemplates this as Sirius paces within a small cell, a man condemned, but he is stunned to see them. Ka-boom! The cell door rockets to the sky. Black claps Harry's shoulder, looking him in the eye, and with a twinkle in his eye, Dumbledore swings open the door as Harry and Hermione enter, catching the faintest glimpse of themselves across the room just as they evaporate. Ron blinks, turns, frowns, then glances to the other side of the room. Hermione glances mischievously to Harry, who jumps. Lupin turns, smiling through haggard eyes, as the Marauder's Map lies open on an otherwise bare desk. Harry nods, looks back at Lupin, unable to disguise his shock at Lupin's appearance, and eyes the open desk drawers and the bare bookshelves.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution

We gaze upward, seeing the tops of the trees etched against the dimming sky. test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: As the Whomping Willow thrashes violently yet muted, Lupin calms it by poking a knot with a stick. The darkening sky silhouettes treetops as bats fly by and Buckbeak snags one. In the shadows, Harry and Hermione sit quietly, Hermione glancing toward the Willow. Under the full moon, shadows reveal Black, Harry, Pettigrew, Lupin, Hermione, Ron, and Snape. Harry observes himself and Sirius while Hermione surveils the Willow. As a chilling wind rises, eerie shadows resembling smoke reveal Dementors. Hermione watches Harry, entranced by the outcrop. The lake freezes, Dementors descend, and Hermione looks anxiously at Harry and Black by the water, dying. Harry's expression shifts, and he brandishes his wand, advancing toward the outcrop where his father appeared. A silver wisp emerges from his wand, transforming into light that illuminates the trees and lake. Harry remains still as the Dementors retreat across the lake, lowering his wand only once they vanish. Whoosh! Harry and Hermione, astride Buckbeak, head to the castle. Hermione reflects as Sirius paces in a cell, shocked to see them. Ka-boom! The door blasts open. Black, surprised, claps Harry's shoulder, while Dumbledore opens the door for them. They catch a glimpse of themselves evaporating across the room. Ron is puzzled, and Hermione gives Harry a playful look. Lupin, smiling wearily, stands by an open Marauder's Map, his appearance startling Harry, who notices bare shelves and open desk drawers.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: As the Whomping Willow thrashes, muted at a distance, Lupin calms it by poking a knot. We see trees against the dark sky as bats fly; Buckbeak catches one. Harry and Hermione sit in shadows; Hermione nods at Harry, glancing at the Whomping Willow. Under the full moon appear Black, Harry, Pettigrew, Lupin, Hermione, Ron, and Sleepwalking Snape. Harry studies himself and Sirius. Shadows over the moon reveal Dementors. Hermione watches Harry, transfixed by the outcrop. The lake begins to freeze as Dementors vanish in a cyclone. Hermione watches the dying Harry and Black. Harry changes, draws his wand, and the wand's silver mist transforms to light, driving off Dementors. Harry waits until they're gone before lowering his arm. Harry and Hermione fly toward the castle on Buckbeak. Sirius, in a cell, is stunned to see them. The cell door blasts open. Black acknowledges Harry as Dumbledore lets them in. They spot themselves across the room before vanishing. Ron is confused. Hermione glances at Harry, who jumps. Lupin, smiling with tired eyes, stands by the Marauder's Map. Harry nods, shocked at Lupin's appearance, noticing open desk drawers and empty bookshelves.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
As the Whomping Willow ominously begins its thrashing dance, its violence feels strangely subdued from this vantage point. In a calm yet decisive manner, Lupin takes hold of a sturdy stick and uses it to prod a specific knot on the gnarled trunk, which instantly pacifies the mighty Willow. Our gaze shifts upward, where we behold the tops of the trees starkly silhouetted against the sky that grows ever darker. As if sprung from some nocturnal ritual, bats take flight in our direction, and we trace the path of one as Buckbeak deftly catches it, the creature's tail giving a brief twitch before vanishing into the beak with a slurping sound. 

Harry and Hermione are seated together in the lengthening shadows that stretch ominously around them. Hermione turns her head to look at Harry, offers him a nod, choosing not to press him with further questions. Her gaze then drifts beyond the boundary of trees toward the foreboding Whomping Willow. Under the illumination of a full moon, shadows emerge, painting a vivid scene of Black, Harry, Pettigrew, Lupin, Hermione, Ron, and a Sleepwalking Snape. Harry's attention zeroes in on himself and Sirius. Hermione's eyes again flit toward the Willow, while Harry redirects his focus back to the tall grass field, noticing the immobilized werewolf. A chill wind begins to whistle, stirring the leaves of the trees, which tremble nervously. Eerie shadows glide over the silver moon, as greasy and fluid as smoke, unveiling the terrible presence of the Dementors. Hermione casts a wary eye on Harry, who remains transfixed, a hunger in his gaze as he looks toward the rugged outcrop. The surface of the lake begins to solidify into ice, as one after another, the Dementors descend from the sky, consumed by the swirling cyclone. Desperately, Hermione's eyes flicker to the cyclone and the pitiful spectacle of Harry and Black, who are at the very edge of the water, in a dire state. 

Harry's expression undergoes a significant transformation, and he raises his wand with resolve, cutting through the trees to reach the rocky outcrop, precisely where he recalls his father appearing. Holding his wand aloft with intent, he surveys the vast sea of Dementors positioned across the lake. A delicate wisp of silver escapes from his wand, hanging momentarily like an ethereal mist, before it unfurls magnificently, causing the trees to burst with radiant light. The lake below blazes with the fire of reflected brilliance, as Harry stands completely motionless, his wand extended toward the heavens above. Across the lake, the Dementors are driven back, and Harry remains as still as a statue until each one has vanished, then lets his arm drop to his side. Whoosh! At that moment, Harry and Hermione dramatically enter the scene astride Buckbeak, soaring boldly toward the castle. 

Hermione reflects on this as Sirius paces within the confines of a small cell, a man who is condemned, yet he is utterly stunned to witness their presence. Ka-boom! The cell door is propelled skyward, rocketing into the air. Black enthusiastically claps Harry on the shoulder, meeting his gaze with intensity, and with a mischievous twinkle in his eye, Dumbledore swings open the door just as Harry and Hermione stride in, catching a fleeting glimpse of themselves from across the room before they disappear. Ron blinks, turns his head, frowns, then looks over to the opposite side of the room. Hermione throws a mischievous glance at Harry, causing him to jump slightly. Lupin turns his head, offering a smile through weary eyes as the Marauder's Map lies open on a desk that is otherwise bare. Harry nods in understanding, casting a glance back at Lupin, unable to fully conceal his shock at Lupin's haggard appearance, as he takes in the sight of open desk drawers and shelves bereft of books.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
As the Whomping Willow begins its ominous thrashing, its violent movements feel strangely subdued from this particular vantage point, almost as if viewed through a distant lens. In a calm yet decisively purposeful manner, Lupin takes hold of a sturdy stick and skillfully uses it to prod a very specific knot nestled within the gnarled trunk of the ancient tree, which instantly pacifies the once-mighty and fearsome Willow. Our gaze naturally shifts upward, where we are greeted by the tops of the trees starkly silhouetted against a sky that grows incrementally darker with every passing moment. As if emerging from some mysterious nocturnal ritual, bats take flight in our direction, and we keenly trace the path of one as Buckbeak deftly and swiftly catches it, the creature's tail giving a brief, final twitch before vanishing entirely into Buckbeak's beak with a quick, slurping sound.

Harry and Hermione find themselves seated together within the lengthening shadows that stretch ominously and ever so forebodingly around them. Hermione turns her head to look attentively at Harry, offering him a courteous nod, consciously choosing not to press him with further questions at that particular moment. Her gaze then drifts beyond the boundary of the trees toward the intimidating Whomping Willow. Under the ethereal illumination of a full moon, shadows emerge, painting a vivid scene involving Black, Harry, Pettigrew, Lupin, Hermione, Ron, and lastly, a sleepwalking Snape. Harry's attention zeroes in on the figures of himself and Sirius. Hermione's eyes once again flit back toward the mighty Willow, while Harry redirects his focus back to the expansive field of tall grass, noticing the immobilized, transformed werewolf. A chilling wind begins to whistle softly, stirring the leaves of the trees that now tremble nervously. Eerie shadows glide over the resplendent silver moon, their movement as greasy and fluid as smoke, unveiling the terrible presence of the fearsome Dementors. Hermione casts a wary, cautious eye on Harry, who remains transfixed, a vivid hunger in his gaze as he looks determinedly toward the rugged outcrop. The surface of the lake begins to solidify into a shimmering layer of ice, as one after another, the Dementors descend ominously from the sky, consumed by the swirling cyclone. Desperately, Hermione's eyes flicker between the cyclone and the pitiful, dire spectacle of Harry and Black, who are precariously positioned at the very edge of the water.

Harry's expression undergoes a significant transformation, and he raises his wand with determined resolve, cutting a path through the trees to reach the rocky outcrop, precisely where he vividly recalls his father appearing. Holding his wand aloft with clear intent, he surveys the vast sea of Dementors positioned menacingly across the lake. A delicate wisp of silver escapes from his wand, hanging momentarily in the air like an ethereal mist, before it unfurls magnificently, causing the trees to burst forth with radiant light. The lake below blazes with the intensity of reflected brilliance, as Harry stands completely motionless, his wand extended unwaveringly toward the heavens above. Across the lake, the Dementors are driven back forcefully, and Harry remains as still as a statue until every last one has vanished, then finally lets his arm drop to his side. Whoosh! At that exact moment, Harry and Hermione dramatically enter the scene astride Buckbeak, soaring boldly and confidently toward the castle.

Hermione reflects on this series of events as Sirius paces tirelessly within the confines of a small cell, a man who appears condemned, yet utterly stunned to witness their unexpected presence. Ka-boom! The cell door is propelled skyward, rocketing into the air with fierce momentum. Black enthusiastically claps Harry on the shoulder, meeting his gaze with intense depth, and with a mischievous twinkle in his eye, Dumbledore swings open the door just as Harry and Hermione stride confidently in, catching a fleeting glimpse of themselves from across the room before they disappear entirely from view. Ron blinks in surprise, turns his head, frowns slightly, then looks over to the opposite side of the room. Hermione throws a mischievous glance at Harry, causing him to jump slightly in response. Lupin turns his head, offering them a tired but warm smile through weary eyes as the Marauder's Map lies open on a desk that is otherwise bare. Harry nods in understanding, casting a glance back at Lupin, unable to fully conceal his shock at Lupin's haggard appearance, as he takes in the sight of open desk drawers and shelves completely bereft of books.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As the Whomping Willow begins to thrash with a fierce intensity, its violent movements seem oddly muted from a distance. Lupin, gripping a stick firmly in his hand, carefully approaches the tree, mindful of its thrashing branches. With precision and practice, he pokes a specific knot on the trunk, instantly calming the fierce Willow into a serene state. Our gaze shifts upward, and we observe the tops of the trees, sharply outlined against the darkening sky. The scene is further animated by a group of bats that fly directly toward us. Our focus is drawn to one particular bat as Buckbeak swiftly snags it from mid-air, and its tail twitches momentarily between Buckbeak's beak before the creature disappears with a slurp. In the lengthening shadows, Harry and Hermione sit closely together. Hermione, choosing to respect Harry's need for silence, looks intently at him and nods, withholding any further questions. Her gaze then shifts beyond the trees, drawn to the presence of the Whomping Willow. Under the full moon's revealing light, shadows move, unveiling Black, Harry, Pettigrew, Lupin, Hermione, Ron, and Sleepwalking Snape. Harry's eyes rest on himself and Sirius, absorbing the scene. Meanwhile, Hermione glances back at the Willow, and Harry's attention is drawn to the tall grass where the werewolf is immobilized. A chill wind begins to rise, rustling the leaves of nearby trees, and eerie shadows sweep over the moon, their movement reminiscent of greasy smoke, slowly uncovering the figure of Dementors. Hermione casts a wary glance at Harry, who stands transfixed, his gaze locked hungrily on the outcrop. Beneath the icy touch of the gathering cold, the lake begins to freeze over, and one after another, Dementors descend from the sky, disappearing into the forming cyclone. Desperation flickers in Hermione's eyes as she darts her gaze back to the cyclone, witnessing the pitiful sight of Harry and Black at the water's edge, their lives seemingly ebbing away. In this critical moment, Harry's expression shifts, determination flashing across his face. He swiftly raises his wand, and with a decisive motion, he slashes through the trees, making his way to the rocky outcrop, the very spot where he had previously seen his father appear. Holding his wand aloft, he scans the vast sea of Dementors gathered on the opposite side of the lake. A delicate wisp of silver emerges from his wand, initially hovering like a mist before it bursts forth magnificently, causing the trees to explode with light. The surface of the lake mirrors this blazing spectacle, and Harry stands resolute and still, his wand extended to the heavens. Across the lake, the Dementors, repelled by the light, begin to retreat. Harry waits, unmoving, until each Dementor has vanished before allowing his arm to fall to his side. Suddenly, with a whoosh, Harry and Hermione dive into the frame on the back of Buckbeak, soaring majestically toward the castle. As they fly, Hermione contemplates the scene: Sirius, pacing within a small cell, a man on the brink of being condemned, is suddenly taken aback by their appearance. The cell door bursts open with a dramatic ka-boom, rocketing into the sky. Black, filled with gratitude and surprise, claps Harry's shoulder, meeting his gaze with a deep sense of connection. A twinkle dances in Dumbledore's eye as he swings open a door, allowing Harry and Hermione to enter. As they do, they catch the faintest glimpse of themselves across the room just before the images evaporate. In a moment of perplexity, Ron blinks, turns, frowns, and casts a glance to the other side of the room. Hermione, sharing in the playful secrecy, glances mischievously at Harry, causing him to jump slightly. Lupin turns toward them, a smile breaking through his haggard appearance as he stands by the Marauder's Map, which lies open on an otherwise bare desk. Harry nods in acknowledgment, though he can't help but look back at Lupin, his shock at Lupin's worn appearance barely concealed. His eyes wander to the open desk drawers and the empty shelves, taking in the sparse surroundings.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: As the Whomping Willow begins to thrash, its violence muted at this distance, Lupin calms the tree by poking a knot on its trunk. Above, the tops of the trees stand against the darkening sky. Bats fly overhead, and Buckbeak claims one in his beak. Harry and Hermione sit quietly, watching the shadows under the full moon reveal Black, Harry, Pettigrew, Lupin, Hermione, Ron, and Sleepwalking Snape. As Harry studies Sirius, a chill wind stirs the leaves, and Dementors appear, casting eerie shadows. Hermione eyes Harry warily as he stares toward the outcrop. The lake freezes as Dementors descend, and Hermione focuses on the desperate scene of Harry and Black by the water's edge. Harry, his expression changing, draws his wand and moves to the outcrop where his father appeared. He casts a Patronus, filling the area with light and driving the Dementors back. Harry stands, his wand raised, until the creatures retreat, then lowers it. Suddenly, Harry and Hermione swoop into view on Buckbeak, flying toward the castle. Hermione reflects on this as Sirius, imprisoned, is surprised to see them. With a loud blast, the cell door is blown open. Sirius, clapping Harry's shoulder, is greeted by Dumbledore, who opens the door for Harry and Hermione, allowing them a brief glimpse of their past selves. Ron reacts with confusion, while Hermione and Harry share a mischievous glance. Lupin, smiling despite his weary appearance, stands by the Marauder's Map on a bare desk. Harry acknowledges Lupin, surprised by his appearance, and observes the empty desk drawers and bookshelves.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: As the Whomping Willow, a magical tree known for its aggressive behavior when disturbed, begins to thrash, its violence oddly muted at this distance, Lupin takes a stick and pokes a knot on the trunk, instantly calming the Willow with a method taught at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. We look upward, seeing the tops of the trees etched against the darkening sky. Bats, often found in the Forbidden Forest beside Hogwarts, fly toward us, and we follow one as Buckbeak, the proud Hippogriff known for his majestic presence and keen hunting skills, snags it, a tail twitching briefly between his beak before it disappears with a slurp. Harry and Hermione sit together in the lengthening shadows, and Hermione looks at Harry, nodding and not wanting to press him further, then glances beyond the trees toward the Whomping Willow, which conceals the entrance to a hidden tunnel under Hogwarts. Shadows emerge under a full moon, revealing Black, the wrongly accused fugitive Sirius Black; Harry, the young wizard at the heart of the events; Pettigrew, the traitorous Animagus; Lupin, the werewolf professor; Hermione, Ron, and Sleepwalking Snape, ensnared by Lupin's condition. Harry studies himself and Sirius, the godfather he barely knows. Hermione glances toward the Willow, and Harry looks back to the tall grass as the werewolf, now uncontrollable under the full moon, is frozen. As a chill wind rises, and the leaves of the trees tremble, eerie shadows flutter over the moon, greasy as smoke, revealing Dementors, the terrifying guards of Azkaban known for feeding on despair. Hermione eyes Harry warily as he is transfixed, staring hungrily toward the outcrop, a place of previous miracles. The lake begins to freeze, and one after another, Dementors drop from the sky, vanishing in the cyclone of magic. Desperately, Hermione's eyes flash to the cyclone and the pitiful sight of Harry and Black at the water's edge, dying under the Dementors' kiss. Harry's face changes, and he draws his wand, slashing through the trees down to the rocky outcrop, the exact spot where his father's spirit once appeared as a Patronus. Poising his wand, he looks out over the sea of Dementors on the other side of the lake. A wisp of silver escapes his wand, hovering like a mist, then blooms magnificently into the form of a stag, and the trees explode with light. The lake blazes with reflected fire, and Harry stands utterly still, wand extended to the heavens. Across the lake, the Dementors retreat, creatures of darkness repelled by the Patronus Charm. Harry waits, still as a statue, until each one is gone before simply letting his arm drop. Whoosh! Harry and Hermione plunge into frame astride Buckbeak, soaring toward the castle, part of a daring rescue mission. Hermione contemplates this as Sirius paces within a small cell, a man condemned to a fate he never deserved, but he is stunned to see them. Ka-boom! The cell door rockets to the sky. Black claps Harry's shoulder, looking him in the eye, and with a twinkle in his eye, Dumbledore, the wise headmaster of Hogwarts, swings open the door as Harry and Hermione enter, catching the faintest glimpse of themselves across the room just as they evaporate, having manipulated time with a Time-Turner. Ron blinks, turns, frowns at the curious scene, then glances to the other side of the room. Hermione glances mischievously to Harry, who jumps, startled by the possibilities of what they've achieved. Lupin turns, smiling through haggard eyes, a reminder of his struggle with lycanthropy, as the Marauder's Map, a magical document that reveals the location of everyone within Hogwarts, lies open on an otherwise bare desk. Harry nods, looks back at Lupin, unable to disguise his shock at Lupin's appearance, and eyes the open desk drawers and the bare bookshelves, remnants of the rushed departure Lupin is preparing for after his secret has been exposed.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: As the Whomping Willow begins to thrash its violence oddly muted at this distance Lupin takes a stick and pokes a knot on the trunk instantly calming the Willow. We look upward seeing the tops of the trees etched against the darkening sky. Bats fly toward us and we follow one as Buckbeak snags it a tail twitching briefly between his beak before it disappears with a slurp. Harry and Hermione sit together in the lengthening shadows and Hermione looks at Harry nodding and not wanting to press him further then glances beyond the trees toward the Whomping Willow. Shadows emerge under a full moon revealing Black Harry Pettigrew Lupin Hermione Ron and Sleepwalking Snape. Harry studies himself and Sirius. Hermione glances toward the Willow and Harry looks back to the tall grass as the werewolf is frozen. As a chill wind rises and the leaves of the trees tremble eerie shadows flutter over the moon greasy as smoke revealing Dementors. Hermione eyes Harry warily as he is transfixed staring hungrily toward the outcrop. The lake begins to freeze and one after another Dementors drop from the sky vanishing in the cyclone. Desperately Hermione's eyes flash to the cyclone and the pitiful sight of Harry and Black at the water's edge dying. Harry's face changes and he draws his wand slashing through the trees down to the rocky outcrop the exact spot where his father appeared. Poising his wand he looks out over the sea of Dementors on the other side of the lake. A wisp of silver escapes his wand hovering like a mist then blooms magnificently and the trees explode with light. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. The lake blazes with reflected fire and Harry stands utterly still. wand extended to the heavens. Across the lake the Dementors retreat and Harry waits still as a statue until each one is gone before simply letting his arm drop. Whoosh. Harry and Hermione plunge into frame astride Buckbeak soaring toward the castle. Hermione contemplates this as Sirius paces within a small cell. a man condemned but he is stunned to see them. Kaboom. The cell door rockets to the sky. Black claps Harry's shoulder looking him in the eye and with a twinkle in his eye Dumbledore swings open the door as Harry and Hermione enter catching the faintest glimpse of themselves across the room just as they evaporate. Ron blinks turns frowns then glances to the other side of the room. Hermione glances mischievously to Harry who jumps. Lupin turns smiling through haggard eyes as the Marauder's Map lies open on an otherwise bare desk. Harry nods looks back at Lupin unable to disguise his shock at Lupin's appearance and eyes. the open desk drawers and the bare bookshelves.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: As the Whomping Willow begins to thrash its violence oddly muted at this distance Lupin takes a stick and pokes a knot on the trunk instantly calming the Willow. We look upward seeing the tops of the trees etched against the darkening sky. Bats fly toward us and we follow one as Buckbeak snags it a tail twitching briefly between his beak before it disappears with a slurp. Harry and Hermione sit together in the lengthening shadows and Hermione looks at Harry nodding and not wanting to press him further then glances beyond the trees toward the Whomping Willow. Shadows emerge under a full moon revealing Black Harry Pettigrew Lupin Hermione Ron and Sleepwalking Snape. Harry studies himself and Sirius. Hermione glances toward the Willow and Harry looks back to the tall grass as the werewolf is frozen. As a chill wind rises and the leaves of the trees tremble eerie shadows flutter over the moon greasy as smoke revealing Dementors. Hermione eyes Harry warily as he is transfixed staring hungrily toward the outcrop. The lake begins to freeze and one after another Dementors drop from the sky vanishing in the cyclone. Desperately Hermione's eyes flash to the cyclone and the pitiful sight of Harry and Black at the water's edge dying. Harry's face changes and he draws his wand slashing through the trees down to the rocky outcrop the exact spot where his father appeared. Poising his wand he looks out over the sea of Dementors on the other side of the lake. A wisp of silver escapes his wand hovering like a mist then blooms magnificently and the trees explode with light. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: As the Dancing Tulip begins to waltz, its rhythm oddly silent at this angle, Marley grabs a broom and tickles a pebble on the path, instantly soothing the Tulip. We glance downward, noticing the bottoms of the bushes traced against the glowing ground. Sparrows flutter away from us, and we chase one as Moonpaw captures it, a wing flapping briefly between his paw before it vanishes with a gulp. Tom and Sally lounge together in the shrinking daylight, and Sally gazes at Tom, shrugging and not choosing to bother him more, then peeks beyond the bushes toward the Dancing Tulip. Lights emerge beneath a crescent sun, displaying Grey, Tom, Barnaby, Marley, Sally, Sam, and Sleepy Grace. Tom examines himself and Grey. Sally scans toward the Tulip, and Tom glances back to the short moss as the troll is thawed. As a warm breeze falls and the buds of the bushes quiver, ghostly lights flutter over the sun, slick as fog, displaying Goblins. Sally observes Tom cautiously as he is rooted, gazing greedily toward the bluff. The pond begins to thaw, and one after another, Goblins ascend from the ground, disappearing in the whirlwind. Frantically, Sally's eyes shift to the whirlwind and the sorrowful scene of Tom and Grey at the water's brink, fading. Tom's expression shifts, and he wields his umbrella, slicing through the bushes up to the sandy bluff, the precise location where his uncle appeared. Steadying his umbrella, he surveys the expanse of Goblins on the opposite shore. A strand of gold escapes his umbrella, lingering like a fog, then blossoms dramatically, and the bushes erupt with glow. The pond radiates with reflected light, and Tom stands entirely silent, umbrella raised to the skies. Beyond the pond, the Goblins withdraw, and Tom waits, motionless as a sculpture, until each one has vanished before softly letting his grip loosen. Whoosh! Tom and Sally leap into view astride Moonpaw, gliding toward the tower. Sally ponders this as Grey strides within a vast room, a person doomed, but is shocked to see them. Ka-boom! The room gate rockets to the moon. Grey pats Tom's back, meeting his gaze, and with a sparkle in his gaze, Doodleswing pulls open the window as Tom and Sally stroll in, glimpsing the faintest shadow of themselves across the hallway just as they dissolve. Sam squints, turns, grimaces, then peeks to the opposite side of the hallway. Sally glances coyly to Tom, who leaps. Marley rotates, grinning through tired lenses, as the Thief's Blueprint lies open on an otherwise empty table. Tom bows, glances back at Marley, unable to mask his surprise at Marley's demeanor, and surveys the open table compartments and the vacant shelf spaces.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: As the Whomping Willow thrashes, Lupin calms it by poking a knot on its trunk. Harry and Hermione sit together, observing the scene in shadows. As shadows emerge under the full moon, they reveal Black, Harry, Pettigrew, Lupin, Hermione, Ron, and Snape. As a cold wind rises and Dementors appear, Harry is transfixed, staring at the outcrop where his father once appeared. Harry draws his wand, releasing a silver mist that blooms and forces the Dementors to retreat. Harry and Hermione then soar on Buckbeak toward the castle, surprising Sirius in his cell. With Dumbledore's help, the cell door bursts open, and Sirius is freed. Back in the castle, Harry and Hermione catch a glimpse of themselves as they vanish, while Ron and Hermione share a mischievous look. Lupin, smiling despite his haggard appearance, glances at the Marauder's Map on an empty desk, leaving Harry shocked by Lupin's appearance and the empty bookshelves.
